newsitem.title: USA: Sprint, Telmex form U.S. marketing venture.
newsitem.headline: Sprint, Telmex form U.S. marketing venture.

text.p: Telefonos de Mexico (Telmex) and Sprint Corp said Friday they formed a joint venture to market long distance service to the U.S. Hispanic market.

The newly formed company, as yet unnamed, filed an application under Section 214 of the Communications Act with the Federal Communications Commission for authority to carry international traffic to and from the United States, they added.

Sprint and Telmex each own 50 percent of the joint venture, which builds on an alliance agreement signed by Sprint and Telmex in April 1995. The name of the new company is expected to be announced in the coming weeks.
The joint venture company will participate directly in the U.S. market, and will carry international traffic as soon as FCC approval is obtained, they added.

The new service will target both the Hispanic residential and business segments, offering packaged calling plans and products. The joint venture will take advantage of Telmex's Hispanic marketing expertise, the companies said.

Telmex said it has made significant investment in interconnection arrangements with U.S. companies now competing in the Mexican market. Telmex operates the largest local and long distance network in Mexico with more than 19,000 miles of fiber optics.
Sprint is a global communications company, operating an all-digital, fiber-optic network in the United States.
